Memory loss: Sleep plays a crucial role in memory consolidation, so without it, people might experience memory loss and difficulty learning new information.
Mood disorders: Lack of sleep can lead to mood swings, irritability, and increased risk of depression and anxiety.
Immune system suppression: Sleep is essential for the immune system to function properly, so without it, people might be more susceptible to infections and illnesses.
Physical health issues: Chronic sleep deprivation can lead to a range of physical health problems, including obesity, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, and weakened bones.
Increased risk of accidents: Drowsy and fatigued individuals are more likely to experience accidents, both at work and on the road.
